description: Slider-based behavioral assessment measuring work style, collaboration, ownership, communication, and risk tolerance.

questions.statement: I produce my best work when I can brainstorm ideas with a group rather than thinking alone.
I am willing to compromise on my own ideas to reach a consensus with the team.
I feel comfortable relying on teammates to complete critical parts of a project.
I am more motivated when my individual contributions are clearly recognized, even while working as part of a team.
I frequently look for tasks that go beyond my formal job responsibilities.
When a project fails, I examine my own actions before considering external factors.
When a task is ambiguous, I prefer to clarify direction before taking independent action.
I feel personally responsible for the overall success of the company, not just my specific role.
I prefer to address conflicts directly and early, even if it feels uncomfortable.
I adjust my explanation style depending on whether I am speaking to technical or non-technical stakeholders.
I believe it is better to over-communicate progress and risks than to wait until work is finished.
I prefer written communication for important decisions because it creates a clear record.
I am comfortable making significant decisions with incomplete data, as long as the risks are understood.
I prefer using established, proven solutions rather than experimenting with new or untested approaches.
It is better to release an imperfect product quickly (MVP), even if it requires fixes after release.
I perform well in environments where priorities change frequently and unexpectedly.

scoring_notes.anti_gaming_rule: If all sliders are set to minimum or maximum values, flag behavioral_reliability as low.
scoring_notes.usage: Behavioral sliders influence hiring decisions but are not pass/fail.
